email_chain.subject: Inquiry: FOB Santos to Shanghai - Soybean Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Lisa,

I hope this message finds you well. We have a vessel available for a soybean shipment from Santos to Shanghai under FOB terms. The cargo size is 12,000MT. The vessel, MV OCEAN BREEZE, has a DWT of 45,000 and an LOA of 180m. The initial freight quote is USD 55 per MT.

Please let me know if this fits your requirements.

Best regards,
John Carter
Maritime Brokers

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: FOB Santos to Shanghai - Soybean Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

Thank you for the offer. The rate seems a bit high compared to current market rates. Could you consider lowering it to USD 50 per MT? Also, could you provide the laycan for this shipment?

Best regards,
Lisa Martin

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: FOB Santos to Shanghai - Rate Adjustment
email_chain.body:
Hi Lisa,

Thank you for your response. We can adjust the rate to USD 52 per MT. The laycan is flexible, but we are looking at a window between October 10 and October 20.

Please confirm if this works for you.

Best regards,
John Carter

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: FOB Santos to Shanghai - Laycan Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

The adjusted rate of USD 52 per MT is acceptable. We would like to confirm the laycan starting on October 15. Could you also provide the demurrage rate per day?

Best regards,
Lisa Martin

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: FOB Santos to Shanghai - Demurrage Rate
email_chain.body:
Hi Lisa,

The laycan starting on October 15 is confirmed. The demurrage rate is USD 4,000 per day.

Please confirm if this is acceptable.

Best regards,
John Carter

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: FOB Santos to Shanghai - Final Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

The demurrage rate of USD 4,000 per day is acceptable. Please proceed with the booking.

Best regards,
Lisa Martin

email_chain.subject: Fwd: FOB Santos to Shanghai - Booking Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Hi Lisa,

The booking is confirmed. We will send the final documents shortly.

Best regards,
John Carter
